subject: Relationships
title: Elopement: The Anti-Wedding
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Elopement: The Anti-Wedding.

hook.text: They drove to a courthouse at 7 AM, married in jeans, and were home by lunch. No guests, no flowers, no regrets.

buildup.text: Elopement has surged 30% since 2020. Couples increasingly reject the expense and stress of traditional weddings.

discovery.text: The average US wedding costs $35,000. Elopements average $2,000. The marriage is identical; only the party differs.

twist.text: Research shows no link between wedding cost and marriage happiness. Expensive weddings don't predict lasting love.

climax.text: Elopement strips marriage to its essence: two people choosing each other. Everything else is optional.

punchline.text: Expensive weddings don't predict happy marriages. The commitment does.

quiz.question: What does research say about wedding cost and marriage happiness?
options: More expensive weddings lead to happier marriages
